jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Developer • Head of R&D — P&B Linking / Openware PSIM / COGEN S.p.a.S.U
jobs.description: Led R&D activities and coordinated teams with stakeholders. Organized work using SCRUM. Reduced tooling costs by ~50% within one year. Led product research, analysis, and design. Managed up to 20 people across 4 product teams (onsite & remote).
jobs.keyProject: Re-engineered the product for cloud distribution (Docker on K8s) in business continuity.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer • Team Lead • R&D Manager — Novigo-Consulting
jobs.description: Designed and implemented application architecture (Zend APIs, React frontends, Node.js automation). Served as project and team lead for national and international teams, managing up to 20 people. As R&D Manager, oversaw software/service selection and integration testing.
jobs.keyProject: Developed RAD automation components used across products.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer — DuckMa s.r.l.
jobs.description: Backend API development (Node.js, PHP). Hybrid Application development with PWA and Ionic. UI/UX designer for PHONOTTO.

jobs.title: Web Developer — System 2000 s.r.l. / Associati s.r.l.
jobs.description: IT consultancy for regional/national projects. .NET development for healthcare management systems. Data analyst for the VIGILO wearable sensors project.

technologies.title: Technologies
technologies.description: Explore the technologies Luca Palomba has experience with and those he's eager to learn.
technologies.lead: A selected list of technologies I've worked with and those I'm (or should be) deepening

desc.jsNode: It's the language/stack that recurs throughout my career: backend, automation, integrations, cloud projects, PWA, orchestration. Maybe I don't know everything and TypeScript surprises me every time, but by now JS is my home.
desc.react: I've led frontend teams, defined RAD components, re-engineered products, developed PWAs. I know lifecycle, rendering, and structuring complex UI architectures.
desc.cloudK8s: In my recent experiences I brought a product natively distributed on K8s with 100+ machines, pipelines, containerization and business continuity. I'm not a pure DevOps, but I have concrete experience with real architectures.
desc.php: I've developed and maintained Zend APIs for years. Recently I worked with Symfony on medium-sized projects. Even if it's less central for me today, the level is definitely expert.
desc.cicd: I've introduced automations, selected tools, optimized pipelines and internal processes. Solid competence, both in processes and R&D.

learning.cloud: Cloud Provider Deep Dive (AWS, GCP, Azure)

learningDesc.python: Deepening Python to expand my skills in automation, internal tools creation, and integration with AI ecosystems, where this language has become the de facto standard.
learningDesc.architectures: Studying advanced architectures to increase robustness, scalability and clarity of complex systems I manage, improving quality of technical decisions and design processes.
learningDesc.wasm: Studying WebAssembly to evaluate new high-performance solutions in the browser and server-side contexts, with the goal of bringing efficiency and portability to distributed and real-time scenarios.
learningDesc.ml: Focusing on Machine Learning to enhance predictive and analytical capabilities of products I oversee, integrating intelligence into decision-making flows and internal automations.
learningDesc.cloud: Deepening knowledge of major cloud providers to consolidate architectural skills on managed services, security, networking and scalability, fundamental for supporting modern enterprise solutions.
learningDesc.dotnetJava: Cause the world still needs it!
